item.title: 南非赢得世界银行 9.25 亿美元贷款，用于改造濒临崩溃的城市
item.description: 世界银行为南非批准了一笔 9.25 亿美元的贷款，用于支持一项为期六年、耗资三倍于此金额的计划，以振兴该国的主要城市。【原文：The World Bank approved a $925 million loan for South Africa to support a six-year program costing three times that amount, as the country seeks to revive its major cities.】

item.title: 美国政府关门临近结束，铝与铜一同上涨
item.description: 随着美国政府结束长达数周停摆的希望升温，铝与铜和其他工业金属一起走高。【原文：Aluminum advanced with copper and other industrial metals as hopes rose for an end to a weeks-long shutdown of the US government.】

item.title: 其他地区贸易限制加剧，中国钢厂转向沙特市场
item.description: 随着保护主义浪潮的兴起，东南亚需求的恢复和中东新市场的增长抵消了保护主义浪潮的影响，中国钢铁企业的出口量仍在不断创下新高。【原文：Chinese steelmakers are still flooding the world with record exports, as a rising tide of protectionism is offset by resilient demand in Southeast Asia and growth in new markets in the Middle East.】

item.title: 印度 IPO 市场蓬勃发展，投资者聚焦 Lenskart 上市
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 行业组织称日本海上风电拍卖需要改革
item.description: 据一个行业组织称，日本的海上风电拍卖应包括更广泛的反馈和更好的定价标准。【原文：Japan’s offshore wind auctions should include broader feedback and a better pricing criteria, according to an industry group, following setbacks that have dented the country’s plans to decarbonize.】

item.title: Lenskart 8.21 亿美元首次公开募股后将在孟买上市交易
item.description: 软银集团支持的 Lenskart Solutions Ltd.公司准备在孟买开始交易，该公司首次公开募股共募集资金 728 亿卢比（约合 8.21 亿美元），并在社交媒体上引发了一场关于印度初创企业估值的讨论。【原文：SoftBank Group Corp.-backed Lenskart Solutions Ltd. is poised to begin trading in Mumbai after an initial public offering that raised 72.8 billion rupees ($821 million) and triggered a debate on social media about India startups’ valuations.】

item.title: 香港第三次发售数字债券，扩展数字债券雄心
item.description: 香港正在推销一套新的以多种货币计价的 "数字原生 "债券，从而进一步推动香港成为全球数字资产中心。【原文：Hong Kong is marketing a new set of “digitally native” bonds denominated in multiple currencies, intensifying the city’s drive to become a global hub for digital assets.】

item.title: 卢克森称新西兰需要成熟的资产出售对话
item.description: 新西兰总理克里斯托弗-卢克松（Christopher Luxon）呼吁就政府资产所有权展开 "成熟的对话"，这是他的国家党打算在 2026 年大选中提出的一项重要政策纲领。【原文：New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon has called for a “mature conversation” about ownership of government assets, in a hint of a key policy platform his National Party intends to take to the 2026 election.】

item.title: 印度快速配送价格战冲击 Eternal、Swiggy 股价
item.description: 印度在线食品杂货配送领域的竞争日趋激烈，对市场领导者 "永恒 "有限公司及其上市竞争对手 Swiggy 有限公司的股价造成了压力。【原文：Intensifying competition in India’s online grocery delivery space is weighing on the shares of market leader Eternal Ltd. and its listed rival Swiggy Ltd.】

item.title: 日本央行通过总结表明 12 月加息的可能性
item.description: 日本央行最近一次董事会会议的政策讨论记录显示，下一次加息最快可能在 12 月，符合许多市场参与者的预期。【原文：A record of policy discussions from the Bank of Japan’s latest board meeting signaled that the next interest rate increase could come as soon as December, matching the expectations of many market participants.】

item.title: 美国经济疲软助力避险需求，黄金上涨
item.description: 由于美国经济疲软的影响超过了华盛顿政府结束停摆的进展，黄金连续第二天上涨。【原文：Gold rose for a second day as a weakening US economy outweighed progress on ending the government shutdown in Washington.】

item.title: 奥林巴斯裁员 2,000 人，人事震荡，创六年来最大涨幅
item.description: 在日本医疗设备制造商奥林巴斯公司公布裁员和精简运营计划后，该公司股价创下六年来最大涨幅。【原文：Olympus Corp. shares soared the most in six years after the Japanese medical device maker unveiled plans to cut jobs and streamline operations.】

item.title: 据称 Permira 接近达成收购伦敦上市基金公司 JTC 的交易
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，私募股权公司 Permira 即将达成协议，收购在伦敦上市的基金解决方案和企业服务提供商 JTC Plc。【原文：Private equity firm Permira is nearing an agreement to acquire JTC Plc, the London-listed provider of fund solutions and corporate services, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 交易商权衡过剩担忧和制裁因素，石油价格保持稳定
item.description: 在数据密集的一周开始之际，交易商权衡了对供应过剩和美国制裁俄罗斯的影响的担忧，石油价格趋于稳定。【原文：Oil steadied as traders weighed concerns about a glut and fallout from US sanctions against Russia at the start of a data-heavy week.】

item.title: 豪瑟称澳大利亚货币政策面临非同寻常的挑战
item.description: 澳大利亚储备银行副行长安德鲁-豪瑟（Andrew Hauser）表示，澳大利亚的货币政策面临着 "非同寻常的挑战"，他在思考澳大利亚经济是会被自身的能力限制所束缚，还是会找到摆脱困境的方法。【原文：Australia’s monetary policy faces “an unusual challenge,” Reserve Bank Deputy Governor Andrew Hauser said, as he pondered whether the nation’s economy will be boxed in by its own capacity constraints or will find a way to break free.】

item.title: Netflix 开始认真对待视频播客
item.description: 流媒体服务正在寻求开发独家节目和授权现有热门节目【原文：The streaming service is looking to develop exclusive shows and license existing hits】

item.title: 亚洲交易商对科技和停摆忧虑持谨慎态度：市场综述
item.description: 本周亚洲市场开局谨慎，投资者正在权衡科技股持续承压和美国政府长期停摆带来的不确定性。【原文：Asian markets are set for a cautious start to the week as investors weigh lingering pressure on tech stocks and uncertainty from the prolonged US government shutdown.】

item.title: 日经指数大涨，高盛认为美国投资者涌向日本
item.description: 据高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：US investors are increasingly buying Japanese stocks focused on tech and artificial intelligence, lured by the country’s outsized returns compared with US stocks, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.】

item.title: 国债销售成为本周债券交易商的主要数据
item.description: 本周，债券交易员将重点关注新的国库券和债券销售需求，因为在美国政府创纪录地停摆之际，市场将继续在没有官方数据的情况下运行。【原文：Bond traders will focus on demand for fresh sales of Treasury notes and bonds this week, as the market continues to operate without official data amid a record US government shutdown.】

item.title: 美国、亚洲和欧洲极地涡旋威胁加剧预示冬季能源账单将增加
item.description:
预报员称，极寒天气有可能增加电力和天然气成本。【原文：

Extreme cold risks boosting power and gas costs, forecasters say.

】

item.title: 澳元有望在澳大利亚央行的限制性政策下实现罕见的年度上涨
item.description: 由于澳央行相对限制性的政策有利于澳元，预计澳元将进一步反弹，并在今年录得罕见的年度涨幅。【原文：Australia’s dollar is expected to rally further and post a rare annual gain this year as the central bank’s relatively restrictive policy favors the local currency.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》称美联储威廉姆斯认为下一次利率会议将采取平衡行动
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》报道，纽约联储主席约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）表示，即使富裕家庭从股市繁荣中获益，中低收入美国人的财务压力也可能威胁到美国经济的韧性。【原文：New York Federal Reserve President John Williams said financial strain among lower and middle-income Americans could threaten the US economy’s resilience, even as wealthier households benefit from a stock market boom, the Financial Times reported.】

item.title: 特朗普政府要求各州撤销全部食品援助资金
item.description: 特朗普政府发布了一份备忘录，要求各州 "立即撤销 "为全面资助 11 月食品援助福利而采取的任何行动，这进一步增加了为 4200 万低收入美国人提供支持的该计划的不确定性。【原文：The Trump administration issued a memo telling states to “immediately undo” any action taken to fully fund November food-aid benefits, adding further uncertainty around the program that provides support to 42 million low-income Americans.】

item.title: 前中央银行行长宣誓就任玻利维亚财政部长
item.description: 玻利维亚前央行行长、经济学家何塞-加布里埃尔-埃斯皮诺萨（José Gabriel Espinoza）周日宣誓就任玻利维亚新任财政部长，负责稳定饱受通胀肆虐、资金短缺和外汇储备减少之苦的经济。【原文：Former central bank director and economist José Gabriel Espinoza was sworn in Sunday as Bolivia’s new finance minister, tasked with stabilizing an economy battered by rampant inflation, shortages, and dwindling foreign reserves.】

item.title: 贝森特称特朗普的 2,000 美元 "红利 "可能来自减税
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，唐纳德-特朗普总统提出的美国人可能会获得至少 2000 美元的关税 "红利 "的建议，可能会通过他今年早些时候签署的经济政策法案中通过的减税措施来实现。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said President Donald Trump’s suggestion that Americans may receive a tariff “dividend” of at least $2,000 could come via the tax cuts passed in his signature economic policy bill earlier this year.】

item.title: 据说由 Tether 支持的 Rumble 和 Northern Data 接近达成合并交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Rumble 公司正在推进对德国数据中心公司 Northern Data AG 的全股收购要约，该交易对目标公司的估值将低于其目前 8.94 亿美元的市值。【原文：Rumble Inc. is pushing ahead with an all-share offer to buy German data center company Northern Data AG, with the deal set to value the target at less than its $894 million current market capitalization, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 寒流袭向东海岸，大雪将袭击芝加哥
item.description: 周日晚些时候到周一的上下班时间，芝加哥将迎来大雪，这将进一步阻碍已经因美国政府关门而中断的航空旅行，并将迎来寒流，给纽约市以及佛罗里达州和德克萨斯州带来接近冰点的温度。【原文：Heavy snow will drop on Chicago late Sunday into Monday’s commute, further snarling air travel already disrupted by the US government shutdown and ushering in a cold blast that will bring near-freezing temperatures to New York City and as deep as Florida and Texas.】

item.title: 从追逐人工智能反弹到担忧泡沫刺激期权需求
item.description: 在经历了动荡的一个月后，无论 S&P 500 指数走向如何，期权波动率似乎都将走高。【原文：No matter which way the S&P 500 Index goes after a tumultuous month, options volatility looks to be headed higher.】

item.title: 罕见的通胀反转使新兴市场比富裕国家更具优势
item.description: 全球通胀趋势的罕见转变有望为今年新兴市场债券的涨势注入新的动力。【原文：A rare turn in global inflation trends is expected to inject fresh momentum into this year’s rally in emerging-market bonds.】

item.title: 苹果计划为 iPhone 提供由卫星驱动的重要新功能
item.description: 苹果公司正计划对其 iPhone 和智能手表的卫星功能进行一系列升级。此外：苹果公司正准备推出首款低价 MacBook，与 Windows 笔记本电脑展开竞争。【原文：Apple is planning a series of upgrades to its satellite features for the iPhone and its smartwatches. Also: The company is nearing a $1 billion-a-year deal to power a revamped Siri with a custom Google Gemini model, and Apple is readying the first low-cost MacBook in a bid to compete with Windows laptops.】
